description.plain:
Major Lazer is an electronic dancehall project created by producers Diplo and Switch in 2009. The current members of the group are Diplo, Walshy Fire, and Ape Drums. Former members include Switch, Skerrit Bwoy, and Jillionaire.

Major Lazer has released four full-length albums: Guns Don’t Kill People… Lazers Do in 2009, Free the Universe in 2013, Peace is the Mission in 2015 and Music is the Weapon, in 2020.

songs.full_title: Cold Water by Major Lazer (Ft. Justin Bieber & MØ)
songs.title: Cold Water

description.plain:
“Cold Water” is about coming together to face adversity and to say that you have your partner’s back no matter what the situation is.

Diplo and Justin Bieber hinted about the song through some cryptic tweets. Diplo then announced to Fact Mag that “Cold Water” would be premiered on his Beats 1 radio show Lazer Sound “sometime Summer 2016.”

In early July, Justin announced their collaboration on the project with a tweet:

https://twitter.com/justinbieber/status/748875758873878530?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

On July 20th, in his final teaser for the track, Justin began releasing pieces of the lyrics to “Cold Water” in the form of direct messages to his fans on Twitter who used the #ColdWater2Days hashtag.

songs.full_title: Lean On by Major Lazer (Ft. DJ Snake & MØ)
songs.title: Lean On

description.plain:
“Lean On” is the lead single from and fourth song on Major Lazer’s third studio album. Peace Is the Mission. The track features MØ on vocals, and DJ Snake on co-production.

It’s an Indian-influenced reggae house song about the exhilaration and disappointment of young love.

When making the video, Diplo had this to say:

India is special and its beauty absolutely humbled me. When we toured there as Major Lazer, it was mind blowing to see our fan-base and we wanted to incorporate the attitude and positive vibes into our video and just do something that embodies the essence of Major Lazer. Major Lazer has always been a culture mashup and to us, India feels like some kind of special creature with one foot in history and one firmly in the future. The experience is something we’ll never forget.”

As of October 2018, it is the sixteenth most viewed video on YouTube with 2.39 billion views.

Bubble Butt is a single off Major Lazer’s Sophomore album “Free The Universe”. It features many artists like Tyga, Bruno Mars, Mystic Davis, and would later feature 2 Chainz.

https://twitter.com/MAJORLAZER/status/338059549699371008

Bubble Butt peaked at number 56 in the US Billboard Hot 100 on August 24, 2013. It became Major Lazer’s most successful single until a year and 5 days later when Lean On peaked at number 4 on the Top 100 charts.

description.plain:
“Run Up” is the second single from Major Lazer’s Music Is The Weapon. It was first heard of by Diplo during the American Music Awards and was slated for release on January 6, 2017, but never actually got released.

On January 7, 2017, it was confirmed that the collaboration was in its final stages, and the track was eventually released on January 26, 2017.

https://twitter.com/Beats1/status/817823128994746368

description.plain:
“Know No Better” is the title track of Major Lazer’s EP with the same name. It was debuted on Beats 1. The song features solo artist Camila Cabello as well as rappers Travis Scott & Quavo who croon about knowing the real persona of an individual who’s living a faux life.

Camila teased the track by tweeting lyrics to the song & later on performing the collaboration at a festival in Florida, her home state:

https://twitter.com/Camila_Cabello/status/868167986804404225

description.plain:
“Be Together” is the opening track of Major Lazer’s third album Peace Is the Mission and its fourth single.

The track featuring rock/pop band Wild Belle, composed of siblings Elliot and Natalie Bergman, and is about a potential, but unlikely relationship.
It is rumored that the lyrics were from a song Lana Del Rey rejected.

songs.artist_names: Major Lazer (Ft. Ellie Goulding & Tarrus Riley)
songs.full_title: Powerful by Major Lazer (Ft. Ellie Goulding & Tarrus Riley)
songs.title: Powerful

description.plain:
The fifth track off Major’s third album Peace Is the Mission. According to Diplo

It features slight dialouge between British Pop singer, Ellie Goulding and Jamaican Reggae singer, Tarrus Riley (son of Jimmy Riley). The conversation suggests that these two people are in a deep relationship and each has a profoundly romantic and intimate effect on the other.

According to Diplo with Radio.com:


That record went through a lot of different steps. We treat all of our songs like DJs and remix them ourselves. We try things out of the ordinary, because people expect Major Lazer to have a very progressive sound with the production. The hook came from working with [Jamaican artist] Tarrus Riley. The name of the beat was “Powerful,” and the one thing about Jamaican artists is once you have a name for a beat, that’s gonna be the lyrics of the song, so you have to be really careful. Luckily, that was a good title. We wrote the lyrics with a girl named Ilsey, who’s a really awesome songwriter.

Ellie had been hitting me up around that time wanting to work with Major Lazer, so I sent her this demo. She was like, ‘whoa, this is the perfect record for me to do with you guys.’ She changed some bits around and did that awesome bridge for us. Then I had my boy Switch, who was one of the original members of Major Lazer, do some drum productions on it and Skrillex added some touches.


Watch the lyric video below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y7OCgi7rANc

songs.full_title: Jessica by Major Lazer (Ft. Ezra Koenig)
songs.title: Jessica

description.plain:
“Jessica” seems a thematic throwback to the days of Ezra Koenig’s band’s debut album. On that album, a majority of songs referenced class and questions of where Ezra sat on its spectrum. Girls were usually at the centre of those quandaries.

“Jessica” comes from a younger perspective however, with a narrator meeting another younger person, on a vacation. Whether the narrator is wealthy is to be determined but it’s obvious she is (her name alone).

There’s a real pedestal mentality as well, with the titular girl literally ‘calling the shots’ and having a mystical, profound lustre. It’s a song about young love and overbearing fascination to someone who might not even return your feelings – or even your gazes.

“Jessica” comes from a younger perspective however, with a narrator meeting another younger person, on a vacation. Whether the narrator is wealthy is to be determined but it’s obvious she is (her name alone).

There’s a real pedestal mentality as well, with the titular girl literally ‘calling the shots’ and having a mystical, profound lustre. It’s a song about young love and overbearing fascination to someone who might not even return your feelings – or even your gazes.

songs.title: Sua Cara

description.plain:
“Sua Cara” (or “Your Face”) is the fifth track on Major Lazer’s EP Know No Better.

The song features Brazilian pop star Anitta and Brazilian drag star Pabllo Vittar, who is breaking through Brazil’s mainstream pop scene with her album Vai Passar Mal.

songs.full_title: Que Calor by Major Lazer (Ft. El Alfa & J Balvin)
songs.title: Que Calor
songs.title_with_featured: Que Calor (Ft. El Alfa & J Balvin)

description.plain:
“Que Calor” translates literally to “What Heat” in English. The song is a club banger with a beat that promotes dancing.

Major Lazer’s album Lazerism is apparently teased in many chapters, and this song was teased as the fourth chapter exclusively as well as the third chapter, referred to as “Lazerism – Chapter 4: Que Calor” and “Chapter 3: Ape Drums”.
Ape Drums is a member of Major Lazer who joined the duo Diplo and Walshy Fire after Jillionaire, a previous member of Major Lazer, left the group.

The song has a rapid flute-type beat which is also associated with a similar beat on Major Lazer’s previous project, “Make It Hot” with Anitta. It is often referred to as the ‘Indian Flute’. It is the first collaboration between Dominican artist El Alfa and Major Lazer, whereas it is the second collaboration between J Balvin and the musical trio.

The song was released as the third single from Lazerism on September 11th, 2019, and was accompanied by a music video premiere the same day. A lyric video for “Que Calor” was officially released a week after the release of the music video, on 17th September.

On El Alfa’s Instagram, it is also mentioned that the music video for ‘Que Calor’ incurred a whopping budget of 1 million dollars, making it one of the most expensive music videos of 2019 and also of all time.

songs.title: All My Love

description.plain:
“All My Love” by Major Lazer featuring Ariana Grande is a electropop track written by Lorde, Grande, and MØ for the Hunger Games: Mockingjay – Part 1 soundtrack, which was also curated by Lorde.



The song is the fifth track off the album, and it was initially not revealed with the rest of the tracklisting on October 21st, however Lorde said this was not meant to be any sort of surprise, but simply because the track was unfinished.

https://twitter.com/lordemusic/status/524625567539150848








And eventually the song was finally announced on November 3rd:

https://twitter.com/lordemusic/status/529422037039591425
